meanings.definition: A person who assesses or sets the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The oyers carefully evaluated the antique furniture before pricing it.
meanings.sent2: The oyers determined the worth of the old painting based on its condition and provenance.
meanings.sent3: The oyers had a tough job deciding how much the rare coin collection was worth.
meanings.sent4: The oyers' expertise in valuing jewelry was as sharp as a diamond cutter's blade.
meanings.sent5: The oyers' ability to appraise artwork accurately made them highly sought after in the art world.

meanings.definition: A person who determines the amount of money to be paid in a legal case.
meanings.sent1: The oyers calculated the compensation for the injured party in the court case.
meanings.sent2: The oyers decided on a fair settlement amount for the plaintiff in the lawsuit.
meanings.sent3: The oyers had to figure out how much the defendant owed in damages after the accident.
meanings.sent4: The oyers' role in the legal proceedings was crucial in reaching a financial resolution.
meanings.sent5: The oyers' expertise in financial matters helped bring closure to the legal dispute.
